means: 经历( plumb的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Relations between the two countries have plumbed new depths.
sentence.Network_cn: 两国关系已降到了最低谷。

sentence.Network_en: Last night's harrowing television pictures plumbed new depths of depravity.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨晚触目惊心的电视画面堕落到了新低。

sentence.Network_en: He had a washing machine plumbed in.
sentence.Network_cn: 他已把洗衣机的各种管子都接好了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 铅测锤 lead铅垂的 plumbedvertical
plumbean 梅豆, plumbed 不冻结, plumbean 铅的
The luggage was plumbed by the customs inspector ., 行李由海关检查员加上了铅封.

list.abs: 铅垂线-概念铅垂线(plumb line)又称重力线。地球重力场中的重力方向线。包含它的平面则称铅垂面。 特点与水准面正交,是野外观测的基准线。悬挂重物而自由下垂.
plum 李子plumb line 铅锤线plumb rule 垂规
地理专业词汇英语翻译(P) ... plucking 冰川拔削 plumb bob 垂球 plumb line 铅垂线.
plumbing configuration 管路配置plumbing fittings 卫生设备plumbing 铅管类装置；管件；卫生管道工程；波导设备；铅锤测量.
plumb line 铅锤线plumb rule 垂规plumb 铅锤

entry.def: If you plumb something mysterious or difficult to understand, you succeed in understanding it.

example.ex: She never abandoned her attempts to plumb my innermost emotions...
example.tran: 她从未放弃过探究我内心深处情感的尝试。

example.ex: Magda had plumbed her own heart for answers.
example.tran: 玛格达在自己心中搜寻答案。

entry.def: If something is plumb in a particular place, it is exactly in that place.

example.ex: The hotel is set plumb in the middle of the high street...
example.tran: 宾馆正好坐落在商街的中段。

example.ex: Grenville took another wallop plumb on the jaw.
example.tran: 格伦维尔又受了一拳，正中下巴。

entry.def: When someone plumbs a building, they put in all the pipes for carrying water.

example.ex: She learned to wire and plumb the house herself.
example.tran: 她学会了自己给房子拉接电线、敷设水管。

entry.def: Plumb is used to give emphasis to an adjective or verb that describes a feeling or condition.

example.ex: I find I'm plumb depressed by it...
example.tran: 我发现自己被它搞得沮丧透顶。

example.ex: This thing has plumb worn me out.

entry.tran: 经受极度的…；表现出极端的…
entry.def: If someone plumbs the depths of an unpleasant emotion or quality, they experience it or show it to an extreme degree.

example.ex: They frequently plumb the depths of loneliness, humiliation and despair...
example.tran: 他们常常陷入孤独、屈辱和绝望的深渊。

example.ex: Is this the first of many questions that will plumb the depths of stupidity?
example.tran: 这个之后是不是还有众多如此愚蠢透顶的问题？

entry.tran: 糟糕到新低点；降至最低点
entry.def: If you say that something plumbs new depths, you mean that it is worse than all the things of its kind that have existed before, even though some of them have been very bad.

example.ex: Relations between the two countries have plumbed new depths...
example.tran: 两国关系已降到了最低谷。

example.ex: Last night's harrowing television pictures plumbed new depths of depravity.
example.tran: 昨晚触目惊心的电视画面堕落到了新低。

means.word_mean: 1. (of water depth) measured by a line and plumb

auth_sentence.content: What she knew of her husband's crimes needn't be plumbed.
auth_sentence.res_content: What she knew of her husband's crimes needn't be plumbed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What she knew of her husband's crimes needn't be plumbed.

auth_sentence.content: Once more, Heinrich has plumbed British musical history to pluck a long-lost composer from obscurity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Once more, Heinrich has plumbed British musical history to pluck a long-lost composer from obscurity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Once more, Heinrich has plumbed British musical history to pluck a long-lost composer from obscurity.

auth_sentence.content: But as mankind has plumbed the oceans, their observations have proven not so far off the mark.
auth_sentence.res_content: But as mankind has plumbed the oceans, their observations have proven not so far off the mark.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But as mankind has plumbed the oceans, their observations have proven not so far off the mark.
